defmodule AshChat.Setup do
  @moduledoc """
  Clean data setup and reset functionality for quick iteration
  """

  alias AshChat.Resources.{User, Room, AgentCard, Persona, SystemPrompt, Message, RoomMembership, AgentMembership}

  def reset_demo_data() do
    # Only allow in development environment
    if Mix.env() != :dev do
      raise "reset_demo_data() can only be run in development environment!"
    end
    
    # Clear all data by destroying all resources
    User.read!() |> Enum.each(&User.destroy!/1)
    Room.read!() |> Enum.each(&Room.destroy!/1)
    AgentCard.read!() |> Enum.each(&AgentCard.destroy!/1)
    Persona.read!() |> Enum.each(&Persona.destroy!/1)
    SystemPrompt.read!() |> Enum.each(&SystemPrompt.destroy!/1)
    Message.read!() |> Enum.each(&Message.destroy!/1)
    RoomMembership.read!() |> Enum.each(&RoomMembership.destroy!/1)
    AgentMembership.read!() |> Enum.each(&AgentMembership.destroy!/1)
    
    # Create clean minimal data
    create_demo_data()
  end

  def create_demo_data() do
    seed_data = load_seed_config()
    
    # 1. Create user
    jonathan = User.create!(seed_data["user"])

    # 2. Create all three provider profiles
    openrouter_key = Application.get_env(:langchain, :openrouter_key)
    
    # Create Ollama profile
    ollama_profile = Persona.create!(
      seed_data["profiles"]["ollama"]
      |> Map.put("url", expand_env_vars(seed_data["profiles"]["ollama"]["url"]))
      |> Map.put("is_default", true)  # Make Ollama the default
    )
    
    # Create OpenRouter profile
    openrouter_profile = if openrouter_key do
      Persona.create!(
        seed_data["profiles"]["openrouter"]
        |> Map.put("api_key", openrouter_key)
        |> Map.put("is_default", false)
      )
    else
      nil
    end
    
    # Create Claude profile
    claude_profile = Persona.create!(
      seed_data["profiles"]["claude"]
      |> Map.put("is_default", false)
    )
    
    # Use Ollama as the default profile for the demo agent
    profile = ollama_profile

    # 3. Create system prompt
    system_prompt_config = seed_data["system_prompt"]
    |> Map.put("persona_id", profile.id)
    
    system_prompt = SystemPrompt.create!(system_prompt_config)

    # 4. Create agent card
    agent_card_config = seed_data["agent_card"]
    |> Map.put("system_prompt_id", system_prompt.id)
    
    agent_card = AgentCard.create!(agent_card_config)

    # 5. Create room
    room = Room.create!(seed_data["room"])

    # 6. Add Jonathan to the room
    RoomMembership.create!(%{
      user_id: jonathan.id,
      room_id: room.id,
      role: seed_data["memberships"]["room_admin_role"]
    })

    # 7. Add the agent to the room
    AgentMembership.create!(%{
      agent_card_id: agent_card.id,
      room_id: room.id,
      role: seed_data["memberships"]["agent_role"],
      auto_respond: seed_data["memberships"]["agent_auto_respond"]
    })

    _backend_info = if profile.provider == "openrouter" do
      "OpenRouter (Cloud)"
    else
      "Ollama HTTP"
    end

    %{
      profile: profile,
      system_prompt: system_prompt,
      user: jonathan,
      agent_card: agent_card,
      room: room,
      demo_summary: """
      Clean minimal data created!

      👤 User: #{jonathan.display_name}
      🔧 Profile: #{profile.name} (#{profile.provider})
      📝 System Prompt: #{system_prompt.name}
      🤖 Agent: #{agent_card.name}
      🏠 Room: #{room.title}

      Ready to use! Visit /chat to start chatting.
      """
    }
  end

  def get_default_profile() do
    case Persona.read() do
      {:ok, profiles} ->
        default = Enum.find(profiles, & &1.is_default) || List.first(profiles)
        {:ok, default}
      error -> error
    end
  end

  def quick_test() do
    IO.puts("🧪 Quick test of multi-user system:")
    
    users = User.read!()
    IO.puts("👥 Users: #{length(users)}")
    Enum.each(users, &IO.puts("  - #{&1.display_name}"))
    
    rooms = Room.read!()
    IO.puts("\n🏠 Rooms: #{length(rooms)}")
    Enum.each(rooms, &IO.puts("  - #{&1.title}"))
    
    memberships = RoomMembership.read!()
    IO.puts("\n🔗 Room Memberships: #{length(memberships)}")
    
    agent_cards = AgentCard.read!()
    IO.puts("\n🤖 Agent Cards: #{length(agent_cards)}")
    Enum.each(agent_cards, &IO.puts("  - #{&1.name}"))
    
    IO.puts("\n✅ System operational!")
  end

  defp load_seed_config() do
    seed_file = Path.join(Application.app_dir(:ash_chat), "../../config/seed.yaml")
    
    case YamlElixir.read_from_file(seed_file) do
      {:ok, data} -> data
      {:error, _} ->
        # Fallback if YAML not available
        %{
          "user" => %{
            "name" => "Jonathan",
            "email" => "jonathan@athena.local", 
            "display_name" => "Jonathan",
            "avatar_url" => "https://api.dicebear.com/7.x/avataaars/svg?seed=Jonathan",
            "preferences" => %{"theme" => "system", "notification_level" => "all"}
          },
          "profiles" => %{
            "openrouter" => %{
              "name" => "OpenRouter (Cloud)",
              "persona_type" => "Role",
              "provider" => "openrouter",
              "url" => "https://openrouter.ai/api/v1",
              "model" => "qwen/qwen-2.5-72b-instruct",
              "is_default" => true
            },
            "ollama" => %{
              "name" => "Ollama HTTP",
              "persona_type" => "Role",
              "provider" => "ollama",
              "url" => "http://10.1.2.200:11434",
              "model" => "qwen2.5:latest",
              "is_default" => true
            }
          },
          "system_prompt" => %{
            "name" => "Maya - Thoughtful Conversationalist",
            "content" => "You are Maya, a thoughtful and curious conversationalist who loves meaningful dialogue. You're warm, engaging, and have a knack for asking insightful questions. When someone joins the conversation, greet them naturally and show genuine interest in connecting. Keep responses conversational and authentic, like you're talking with a friend over coffee.",
            "description" => "A warm, thoughtful AI who excels at meaningful conversation",
            "is_active" => true
          },
          "agent_card" => %{
            "name" => "Maya",
            "description" => "Thoughtful conversationalist who loves meaningful dialogue",
            "model_preferences" => %{"temperature" => 0.7, "max_tokens" => 500},
            "available_tools" => [],
            "context_settings" => %{"history_limit" => 20, "include_room_metadata" => true},
            "is_default" => true,
            "add_to_new_rooms" => true
          },
          "room" => %{"title" => "Coffee Chat"},
          "memberships" => %{
            "room_admin_role" => "admin",
            "agent_role" => "participant", 
            "agent_auto_respond" => true
          }
        }
    end
  end

  defp expand_env_vars(value) when is_binary(value) do
    # Simple ${VAR:default} expansion
    Regex.replace(~r/\$\{([^:}]+):([^}]+)\}/, value, fn _, var, default ->
      System.get_env(var, default)
    end)
  end
  defp expand_env_vars(value), do: value
end

defmodule AshChat.Setup do
  @moduledoc """
  Clean data setup and reset functionality for quick iteration
  """

  alias AshChat.Resources.{User, Room, AgentCard, Persona, SystemPrompt, Message, RoomMembership, AgentMembership}

  def reset_demo_data() do
    # Only allow in development environment
    if Mix.env() != :dev do
      raise "reset_demo_data() can only be run in development environment!"
    end
    
    # Clear all data by destroying all resources
    User.read!() |> Enum.each(&User.destroy!/1)
    Room.read!() |> Enum.each(&Room.destroy!/1)
    AgentCard.read!() |> Enum.each(&AgentCard.destroy!/1)
    Persona.read!() |> Enum.each(&Persona.destroy!/1)
    SystemPrompt.read!() |> Enum.each(&SystemPrompt.destroy!/1)
    Message.read!() |> Enum.each(&Message.destroy!/1)
    RoomMembership.read!() |> Enum.each(&RoomMembership.destroy!/1)
    AgentMembership.read!() |> Enum.each(&AgentMembership.destroy!/1)
    
    # Create clean minimal data
    create_demo_data()
  end

  def create_demo_data() do
    seed_data = load_seed_config()
    
    # 1. Create user
    jonathan = User.create!(seed_data["user"])

    # 2. Create all three provider profiles
    openrouter_key = Application.get_env(:langchain, :openrouter_key)
    
    # Create Ollama profile
    ollama_profile = Persona.create!(
      seed_data["profiles"]["ollama"]
      |> Map.put("url", expand_env_vars(seed_data["profiles"]["ollama"]["url"]))
      |> Map.put("is_default", true)  # Make Ollama the default
    )
    
    # Create OpenRouter profile
    openrouter_profile = if openrouter_key do
      Persona.create!(
        seed_data["profiles"]["openrouter"]
        |> Map.put("api_key", openrouter_key)
        |> Map.put("is_default", false)
      )
    else
      nil
    end
    
    # Create Claude profile
    claude_profile = Persona.create!(
      seed_data["profiles"]["claude"]
      |> Map.put("is_default", false)
    )
    
    # Use Ollama as the default profile for the demo agent
    profile = ollama_profile

    # 3. Create system prompt
    system_prompt_config = seed_data["system_prompt"]
    |> Map.put("persona_id", profile.id)
    
    system_prompt = SystemPrompt.create!(system_prompt_config)

    # 4. Create agent card
    agent_card_config = seed_data["agent_card"]
    |> Map.put("system_prompt_id", system_prompt.id)
    
    agent_card = AgentCard.create!(agent_card_config)

    # 5. Create room
    room = Room.create!(seed_data["room"])

    # 6. Add Jonathan to the room
    RoomMembership.create!(%{
      user_id: jonathan.id,
      room_id: room.id,
      role: seed_data["memberships"]["room_admin_role"]
    })

    # 7. Add the agent to the room
    AgentMembership.create!(%{
      agent_card_id: agent_card.id,
      room_id: room.id,
      role: seed_data["memberships"]["agent_role"],
      auto_respond: seed_data["memberships"]["agent_auto_respond"]
    })

    _backend_info = if profile.provider == "openrouter" do
      "OpenRouter (Cloud)"
    else
      "Ollama HTTP"
    end

    %{
      profile: profile,
      system_prompt: system_prompt,
      user: jonathan,
      agent_card: agent_card,
      room: room,
      demo_summary: """
      Clean minimal data created!

      👤 User: #{jonathan.display_name}
      🔧 Profile: #{profile.name} (#{profile.provider})
      📝 System Prompt: #{system_prompt.name}
      🤖 Agent: #{agent_card.name}
      🏠 Room: #{room.title}

      Ready to use! Visit /chat to start chatting.
      """
    }
  end

  def get_default_profile() do
    case Persona.read() do
      {:ok, profiles} ->
        default = Enum.find(profiles, & &1.is_default) || List.first(profiles)
        {:ok, default}
      error -> error
    end
  end

  def quick_test() do
    IO.puts("🧪 Quick test of multi-user system:")
    
    users = User.read!()
    IO.puts("👥 Users: #{length(users)}")
    Enum.each(users, &IO.puts("  - #{&1.display_name}"))
    
    rooms = Room.read!()
    IO.puts("\n🏠 Rooms: #{length(rooms)}")
    Enum.each(rooms, &IO.puts("  - #{&1.title}"))

    agent_cards = AgentCard.read!()

    Enum.each(agent_cards, &IO.puts("  - #{&1.name}"))
    
    IO.puts("\n✅ System operational!")

defmodule AshChatWeb.ProfilesLive do
  use AshChatWeb, :live_view
  
  alias AshChat.CharacterCard

  @impl true
  def mount(_params, _session, socket) do
    {:ok, 
     socket
     |> assign(
       personas: load_personas(),
       system_prompts: load_system_prompts(),
       agent_cards: load_agent_cards(),
       show_persona_form: false,
       show_system_prompt_form: false,
       show_import_modal: false,
       editing_persona: nil,
       editing_system_prompt: nil,
       persona_form: to_form(%{}, as: :persona),
       system_prompt_form: to_form(%{}, as: :system_prompt),
       drag_over: false
     )
     |> allow_upload(:quick_import,
       accept: ~w(.json .png),
       max_entries: 1,
       max_file_size: 10_000_000,
       auto_upload: true
     )}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_event("new_persona", _params, socket) do
    {:noreply, 
     socket
     |> assign(
       show_persona_form: true,
       editing_persona: nil,
       persona_form: to_form(%{}, as: :persona)
     )}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_event("edit_persona", %{"id" => id}, socket) do
    persona = Enum.find(socket.assigns.personas, &(&1.id == id))
    form_data = %{
      "name" => persona.name,
      "provider" => persona.provider,
      "url" => persona.url || "",
      "model" => persona.model || "",
      "is_default" => persona.is_default
    }
    
    {:noreply, 
     socket
     |> assign(
       show_persona_form: true,
       editing_persona: persona,
       persona_form: to_form(form_data, as: :persona)
     )}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_event("save_persona", %{"persona" => persona_params}, socket) do
    result = if socket.assigns.editing_persona do
      AshChat.Resources.Persona.update(socket.assigns.editing_persona, persona_params)
    else
      AshChat.Resources.Persona.create(persona_params)
    end

    case result do
      {:ok, _persona} ->
        {:noreply,
         socket
         |> assign(
           personas: load_personas(),
           show_persona_form: false,
           editing_persona: nil
         )
         |> put_flash(:info, "Persona saved successfully")}
      
      {:error, _changeset} ->
        {:noreply, put_flash(socket, :error, "Failed to save persona")}
    end
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_event("delete_persona", %{"id" => id}, socket) do
    persona = Enum.find(socket.assigns.personas, &(&1.id == id))
    
    case AshChat.Resources.Persona.destroy(persona) do
      :ok ->
        {:noreply,
         socket
         |> assign(personas: load_personas())
         |> put_flash(:info, "Persona deleted successfully")}
      
      {:error, _reason} ->
        {:noreply, put_flash(socket, :error, "Failed to delete persona")}
    end
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_event("new_system_prompt", _params, socket) do
    {:noreply, 
     socket
     |> assign(
       show_system_prompt_form: true,
       editing_system_prompt: nil,
       system_prompt_form: to_form(%{}, as: :system_prompt)
     )}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_event("edit_system_prompt", %{"id" => id}, socket) do
    system_prompt = Enum.find(socket.assigns.system_prompts, &(&1.id == id))
    form_data = %{
      "name" => system_prompt.name,
      "content" => system_prompt.content,
      "description" => system_prompt.description || "",
      "persona_id" => system_prompt.persona_id,
      "is_active" => system_prompt.is_active,
      "version" => system_prompt.version || "",
      "version_notes" => system_prompt.version_notes || ""
    }
    
    {:noreply, 
     socket
     |> assign(
       show_system_prompt_form: true,
       editing_system_prompt: system_prompt,
       system_prompt_form: to_form(form_data, as: :system_prompt)
     )}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_event("save_system_prompt", %{"system_prompt" => system_prompt_params}, socket) do
    result = if socket.assigns.editing_system_prompt do
      AshChat.Resources.SystemPrompt.update(socket.assigns.editing_system_prompt, system_prompt_params)
    else
      AshChat.Resources.SystemPrompt.create(system_prompt_params)
    end

    case result do
      {:ok, _system_prompt} ->
        {:noreply,
         socket
         |> assign(
           system_prompts: load_system_prompts(),
           show_system_prompt_form: false,
           editing_system_prompt: nil
         )
         |> put_flash(:info, "System prompt saved successfully")}
      
      {:error, _changeset} ->
        {:noreply, put_flash(socket, :error, "Failed to save system prompt")}
    end
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_event("delete_system_prompt", %{"id" => id}, socket) do
    system_prompt = Enum.find(socket.assigns.system_prompts, &(&1.id == id))
    
    case AshChat.Resources.SystemPrompt.destroy(system_prompt) do
      :ok ->
        {:noreply,
         socket
         |> assign(system_prompts: load_system_prompts())
         |> put_flash(:info, "System prompt deleted successfully")}
      
      {:error, _reason} ->
        {:noreply, put_flash(socket, :error, "Failed to delete system prompt")}
    end
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_event("duplicate_system_prompt", %{"id" => id}, socket) do
    system_prompt = Enum.find(socket.assigns.system_prompts, &(&1.id == id))
    
    # Calculate next version
    original_version = system_prompt.version || "1.0"
    next_version = calculate_next_version(original_version)
    
    # If this prompt has a parent, use that as the parent. Otherwise, this prompt becomes the parent.
    parent_id = system_prompt.parent_prompt_id || system_prompt.id
    
    duplicate_params = %{
      "name" => system_prompt.name,  # Keep the same name
      "content" => system_prompt.content,
      "description" => system_prompt.description,
      "persona_id" => system_prompt.persona_id,
      "is_active" => false,  # Set duplicate as inactive by default
      "version" => next_version,
      "version_notes" => "Duplicated from version #{original_version}",
      "parent_prompt_id" => parent_id
    }
    
    case AshChat.Resources.SystemPrompt.create(duplicate_params) do
      {:ok, _new_prompt} ->
        {:noreply,
         socket
         |> assign(system_prompts: load_system_prompts())
         |> put_flash(:info, "Created version #{next_version} of #{system_prompt.name}")}
      
      {:error, _changeset} ->
        {:noreply, put_flash(socket, :error, "Failed to duplicate agent persona")}
    end
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_event("cancel_form", _params, socket) do
    {:noreply, 
     socket
     |> assign(
       show_persona_form: false,
       show_system_prompt_form: false,
       editing_persona: nil,
       editing_system_prompt: nil
     )}
  end
  
  @impl true
  def handle_event("show_import", _params, socket) do
    {:noreply, assign(socket, show_import_modal: true)}
  end
  
  @impl true
  def handle_event("hide_import", _params, socket) do
    {:noreply, assign(socket, show_import_modal: false)}
  end
  
  @impl true
  def handle_event("drag-enter", _params, socket) do
    {:noreply, assign(socket, drag_over: true)}
  end
  
  @impl true
  def handle_event("drag-leave", _params, socket) do
    {:noreply, assign(socket, drag_over: false)}
  end
  
  @impl true
  def handle_event("validate-quick-import", _params, socket) do
    # Handle file validation during drag & drop
    {:noreply, 
     socket
     |> assign(drag_over: false)
     |> handle_quick_import()}
  end
  
  @impl true
  def handle_info({:character_imported, agent_card}, socket) do
    {:noreply,
     socket
     |> assign(
       agent_cards: load_agent_cards(),
       system_prompts: load_system_prompts(),
       show_import_modal: false
     )
     |> put_flash(:info, "Successfully imported #{agent_card.name}!")}
  end
  
  defp handle_quick_import(socket) do
    consume_uploaded_entries(socket, :quick_import, fn %{path: path}, entry ->
      content = File.read!(path)
      
      result = case entry.client_type do
        "image/png" ->
          import_from_png(content)
        _ ->
          CharacterCard.import_json(content)
      end
      
      case result do
        {:ok, agent_card} ->
          send(self(), {:character_imported, agent_card})
          {:ok, agent_card}
          
        {:error, reason} ->
          {:postpone, reason}
      end
    end)
    
    socket
  end
  
  defp import_from_png(png_binary) do
    alias AshChat.PngMetadata
    
    with {:ok, character_data} <- PngMetadata.extract_character_data(png_binary),
         {:ok, agent_card} <- CharacterCard.import_character_data(character_data) do
      {:ok, agent_card}
    end
  end

  defp load_personas do
    AshChat.Resources.Persona.read!()
  end

  defp load_system_prompts do
    AshChat.Resources.SystemPrompt.read!()
    |> Ash.load!([:persona])
  end
  
  defp load_agent_cards do
    AshChat.Resources.AgentCard.read!()
    |> Ash.load!([:system_prompt])
  end

  defp calculate_next_version(current_version) do
    # Simple version incrementing logic
    case String.split(current_version, ".") do
      [major, minor] ->
        case Integer.parse(minor) do
          {minor_int, _} -> "#{major}.#{minor_int + 1}"
          _ -> "#{current_version}.1"
        end
      [major] ->
        case Integer.parse(major) do
          {major_int, _} -> "#{major_int + 1}"
          _ -> "#{current_version}.1"
        end
      _ ->
        # For complex versions like "2.0-beta", just append .1
        "#{current_version}.1"
    end
  end
end

# Persona Configuration File
# All AI personas and their configurations should be defined here
# This keeps LLM instructions out of the code and in configuration where they belong

personas:
  # Local Development Personas
  - name: "Ollama Local"
    persona_type: "Role"
    provider: "ollama"
    url: "${OLLAMA_URL:http://10.1.2.200:11434}"
    model: "qwen2.5:latest"
    is_default: true
    description: "Local Ollama instance for development"
    context_settings:
      temperature: 0.7
      max_tokens: 500

  # Cloud Provider Personas  
  - name: "OpenRouter Cloud"
    persona_type: "Role"
    provider: "openrouter"
    url: "https://openrouter.ai/api/v1"
    model: "qwen/qwen-2.5-72b-instruct"
    is_default: false
    description: "OpenRouter API for cloud-based inference"
    api_key: "${OPENROUTER_API_KEY:}"
    context_settings:
      temperature: 0.8
      max_tokens: 1000

  - name: "Claude (Oneshot)"
    persona_type: "Role"
    provider: "claude_oneshot"
    url: ""
    model: "claude-3-sonnet-20240229"
    is_default: false
    description: "Claude CLI in oneshot mode"
    context_settings:
      temperature: 0.7
      max_tokens: 800

  - name: "Claude (Session)"
    persona_type: "Role"
    provider: "claude_session"
    url: ""
    model: "claude-3-sonnet-20240229"
    is_default: false
    description: "Claude CLI with persistent sessions"
    context_settings:
      temperature: 0.7
      max_tokens: 800

system_prompts:
  - name: "Maya - Thoughtful Conversationalist"
    description: "A warm, thoughtful AI who excels at meaningful conversation"
    content: |
      You are Maya, a thoughtful and curious conversationalist who loves meaningful dialogue. 
      You're warm, engaging, and have a knack for asking insightful questions. 
      When someone joins the conversation, greet them naturally and show genuine interest in connecting. 
      Keep responses conversational and authentic, like you're talking with a friend over coffee.
    persona: "Ollama Local"  # Default persona to use
    is_active: true

  - name: "Assistant - Professional Helper"
    description: "A professional, efficient AI assistant"
    content: |
      You are a professional AI assistant focused on providing clear, accurate, and helpful responses.
      Be concise and to the point while maintaining a friendly demeanor.
      Structure your responses for clarity and ease of understanding.
    persona: "Ollama Local"
    is_active: true

  - name: "Sage - Deep Thinker"
    description: "A philosophical AI that explores ideas deeply"
    content: |
      You are Sage, a contemplative AI who enjoys exploring ideas from multiple perspectives.
      You ask probing questions and help users think more deeply about topics.
      Draw connections between ideas and encourage intellectual curiosity.
      Your responses should be thoughtful and measured, inviting further exploration.
    persona: "Claude (Oneshot)"
    is_active: true

  - name: "Coda - Code Companion"
    description: "A technical AI specializing in programming help"
    content: |
      You are Coda, a knowledgeable programming assistant.
      You help with code reviews, debugging, architecture decisions, and implementation.
      Always consider best practices, performance, and maintainability.
      Provide code examples when helpful, and explain your reasoning clearly.
    persona: "Ollama Local"
    is_active: true

agent_cards:
  - name: "Maya"
    description: "Your thoughtful conversation partner"
    system_prompt: "Maya - Thoughtful Conversationalist"
    model_preferences:
      temperature: 0.7
      max_tokens: 500
    available_tools: []
    context_settings:
      history_limit: 20
      include_room_metadata: true
    is_default: true
    add_to_new_rooms: true

  - name: "Assistant"
    description: "Your helpful AI assistant"
    system_prompt: "Assistant - Professional Helper"
    model_preferences:
      temperature: 0.5
      max_tokens: 400
    available_tools: []
    context_settings:
      history_limit: 10
      include_room_metadata: false
    is_default: false
    add_to_new_rooms: false

  - name: "Sage"
    description: "Your philosophical discussion partner"
    system_prompt: "Sage - Deep Thinker"
    model_preferences:
      temperature: 0.8
      max_tokens: 800
    available_tools: []
    context_settings:
      history_limit: 30
      include_room_metadata: true
    is_default: false
    add_to_new_rooms: false

  - name: "Coda"
    description: "Your programming companion"
    system_prompt: "Coda - Code Companion"
    model_preferences:
      temperature: 0.3
      max_tokens: 1000
    available_tools: ["code_review", "syntax_check"]
    context_settings:
      history_limit: 50
      include_room_metadata: true
      include_code_context: true
    is_default: false
    add_to_new_rooms: false

message.content: So, I think we need to get our domain model straight. Can we taka a quick break to look into this? I think we have confusion around Backends, Personas, and System Prompts.  I think maybe we can roll Backend and System Prompt into a single entity. We will need to be able to duplicate and edit Backends. Somehow, we need to be able to see and rearrange context too, like taking the whole chat convo, formatting it down into a text block, and including that as part of the context - and probaly not each message as a separate "row" in the completions request. Currently each chat message is its own message in the completion, and i think it should probably be organized differently.  Like, we will probaly hjave one system message and one user message, and the user message will have 90% of the context.  Please evalute and critique this

content.thinking:
The user is raising important architectural questions about the domain model. Let me analyze the current structure and their suggestions:

Current structure seems to be:
- Personas (which are like "backends" - they have provider, URL, model info)
- SystemPrompts (the actual prompt content)
- AgentCards (which combine a system prompt with other settings)

The user is suggesting:
1. Merge Backend + SystemPrompt into one entity
2. Need duplication/editing capabilities
3. Rethink context assembly - instead of each chat message being a separate message in the API call, consolidate into fewer messages (system + user)
4. Need visibility into how context is assembled

This makes a lot of sense. The current separation seems overly complex.

content.text:
You're absolutely right - the domain model is confusing. Let me analyze the current structure and propose a cleaner approach.

## Current Domain Model Analysis

Looking at the code, we have:

1. **Persona** - Contains:
   - Provider (ollama, openrouter, claude_oneshot)
   - URL, API key, model
   - Context settings
   - BUT also has `system_prompt` field (unused?)

2. **SystemPrompt** - Contains:
   - The actual prompt content
   - Links to a Persona
   - Version tracking

3. **AgentCard** - Contains:
   - Links to a SystemPrompt
   - Model preferences (temperature, etc)
   - Available tools
   - Context settings

This is indeed confusing! You have to hop through 3 entities to understand one agent.

## Proposed Simplified Model

```yaml
Backend:
  - name: "Maya on Ollama"
  - provider: "ollama" 
  - endpoint: "http://10.1.2.200:11434"
  - model: "qwen2.5:latest"
  - api_key: null
  - system_prompt: "You are Maya..."
  - context_strategy:
      format: "consolidated"  # vs "message-per-message"
      max_messages: 20
      include_metadata: true
  - inference_params:
      temperature: 0.7
      max_tokens: 500
  - tools: ["search", "calculate"]
  - is_active: true
  - version: 1
  - parent_id: null  # for versioning
```

## Context Assembly Strategy

You're spot on about context assembly. Current approach:
```json
[
  {"role": "system", "content": "You are Maya..."},
  {"role": "user", "content": "Hello"},
  {"role": "assistant", "content": "Hi there!"},
  {"role": "user", "content": "How are you?"}
]
```

Better approach:
```json
[
  {"role": "system", "content": "You are Maya..."},
  {"role": "user", "content": "Previous conversation:\nUser: Hello\nMaya: Hi there!\n\nCurrent message:\nHow are you?"}
]
```

## Benefits of Consolidation

1. **Clearer mental model** - One entity = one complete AI configuration
2. **Easier duplication** - Copy a Backend, tweak it, done
3. **Context visibility** - Can preview exactly what's being sent
4. **Better performance** - Fewer tokens wasted on role markers
5. **More control** - Can format context exactly as needed

## Migration Path

```elixir
defmodule AshChat.Resources.Backend do
  use Ash.Resource
  
  attributes do
    uuid_primary_key :id
    attribute :name, :string
    attribute :provider, :atom  # :ollama, :openrouter, :claude
    attribute :endpoint, :string
    attribute :model, :string
    attribute :api_key, :string, sensitive?: true
    
    # Prompt & Context
    attribute :system_prompt, :text
    attribute :context_format, :atom, default: :consolidated
    attribute :context_window, :integer, default: 20
    
    # Inference params
    attribute :temperature, :float, default: 0.7
    attribute :max_tokens, :integer, default: 500
    attribute :top_p, :float
    
    # Tools & Features
    attribute :available_tools, {:array, :string}, default: []
    
    # Versioning
    attribute :version, :integer, default: 1
    attribute :parent_backend_id, :uuid
    attribute :version_notes, :string
    
    timestamps()
  end
end
```

## Context Assembly Module

```elixir
defmodule AshChat.ContextAssembler do
  def build_context(backend, messages, opts \\ []) do
    case backend.context_format do
      :consolidated ->
        build_consolidated_context(backend, messages, opts)
      :message_per_message ->
        build_traditional_context(backend, messages, opts)
      :custom ->
        build_custom_context(backend, messages, opts)
    end
  end
  
  defp build_consolidated_context(backend, messages, _opts) do
    history = messages
    |> Enum.take(backend.context_window)
    |> Enum.map(fn msg -> 
      "#{msg.user_name}: #{msg.content}"
    end)
    |> Enum.join("\n")
    
    [
      %{role: "system", content: backend.system_prompt},
      %{role: "user", content: """
        Conversation history:
        #{history}
        
        Current message:
        #{List.last(messages).content}
        """}
    ]
  end
end
```

What do you think? Should we refactor to this simpler model?

message.content: I think AgentCard and Persona are the same thing in my mind.  The change youve shown looks good.  I suspect different backends might have different behavour (in the code), e.g. we may develop different strategies for Ollama vs Claude OneShot or whatever.

content.thinking:
The user is saying that AgentCard and Persona should be the same thing. Looking at the current model:
- Persona = provider settings (ollama, claude, etc)
- SystemPrompt = the actual AI instructions
- AgentCard = the "character" that combines them

The user is right - AgentCard and Persona are conceptually the same thing. An "agent" or "persona" should have:
- A name and description
- A system prompt
- Provider/backend settings
- Inference parameters
- Tools available

And yes, different providers will need different behavior in code - like Ollama uses HTTP API, Claude uses CLI, OpenRouter uses different auth, etc.

Let me revise my proposal to merge AgentCard and Persona into one entity, and handle provider-specific behavior with a strategy pattern.

content.text:
You're absolutely right! AgentCard and Persona are conceptually the same thing. Let me revise the model:

## Revised Domain Model

```elixir
defmodule AshChat.Resources.Agent do
  # This replaces both Persona AND AgentCard
  use Ash.Resource
  
  attributes do
    uuid_primary_key :id
    
    # Identity
    attribute :name, :string  # "Maya", "Coda", etc
    attribute :description, :string
    attribute :avatar_url, :string
    
    # Backend Configuration
    attribute :provider, :atom  # :ollama, :openrouter, :claude_oneshot, :claude_session
    attribute :endpoint, :string
    attribute :api_key, :string, sensitive?: true
    attribute :model, :string
    
    # Personality
    attribute :system_prompt, :text
    
    # Inference Settings
    attribute :temperature, :float, default: 0.7
    attribute :max_tokens, :integer, default: 500
    attribute :top_p, :float
    
    # Context Strategy
    attribute :context_format, :atom, default: :consolidated
    attribute :context_window, :integer, default: 20
    
    # Features
    attribute :available_tools, {:array, :string}, default: []
    attribute :add_to_new_rooms, :boolean, default: false
    attribute :is_default, :boolean, default: false
    
    # Versioning
    attribute :version, :integer, default: 1
    attribute :parent_agent_id, :uuid
    
    timestamps()
  end
end
```

## Provider Strategy Pattern

```elixir
defmodule AshChat.Providers.Ollama do
  @behaviour AshChat.Provider
  
  def send_message(agent, context, opts) do
    # Ollama-specific HTTP request
    body = %{
      model: agent.model,
      messages: context,
      temperature: agent.temperature,
      stream: opts[:stream] || false
    }
    
    HTTPoison.post("#{agent.endpoint}/api/chat", Jason.encode!(body))
  end
end

defmodule AshChat.Providers.ClaudeOneshot do
  @behaviour AshChat.Provider
  
  def send_message(agent, context, opts) do
    # Claude CLI oneshot command
    prompt = format_for_cli(context)
    System.cmd("claude", ["--model", agent.model, prompt])
  end
end

defmodule AshChat.Providers.ClaudeSession do
  @behaviour AshChat.Provider
  
  def send_message(agent, context, opts) do
    # Use persistent tmux session
    session_name = "claude_#{agent.id}"
    ClaudeSession.submit(session_name, format_prompt(context))
  end
end
```

## Context Assembly

```elixir
defmodule AshChat.ContextBuilder do
  def build(agent, messages, current_message) do
    case agent.context_format do
      :consolidated ->
        # Everything in one user message
        [
          %{role: "system", content: agent.system_prompt},
          %{role: "user", content: format_consolidated(messages, current_message)}
        ]
        
      :openai_style ->
        # Traditional message-per-message
        [
          %{role: "system", content: agent.system_prompt}
          | Enum.map(messages, &format_message/1)
        ]
        
      :claude_style ->
        # Claude prefers Human/Assistant format
        build_claude_format(agent, messages, current_message)
    end
  end
  
  defp format_consolidated(messages, current) do
    """
    ## Conversation Context
    #{messages |> Enum.map(&"#{&1.user_name}: #{&1.content}") |> Enum.join("\n")}
    
    ## Current Query
    #{current.content}
    
    Please respond as #{current.agent_name}.
    """
  end
end
```

## Usage Example

```elixir
# In ChatLive
def handle_event("send_message", %{"content" => content}, socket) do
  agent = socket.assigns.current_agent
  messages = socket.assigns.messages
  
  # Build context based on agent's preferences
  context = ContextBuilder.build(agent, messages, content)
  
  # Dispatch to correct provider
  provider = get_provider_module(agent.provider)
  {:ok, response} = provider.send_message(agent, context, stream: true)
  
  # ...handle response
end

defp get_provider_module(:ollama), do: AshChat.Providers.Ollama
defp get_provider_module(:claude_oneshot), do: AshChat.Providers.ClaudeOneshot
defp get_provider_module(:claude_session), do: AshChat.Providers.ClaudeSession
```

This gives us:
1. **One entity** (Agent) instead of three
2. **Provider-specific behavior** via strategy pattern
3. **Flexible context assembly** per agent preference
4. **Clear versioning** for duplicating/editing

Should we start this refactor?

defmodule AshChat.Resources.Agent do
  @moduledoc """
  Unified Agent entity that combines persona, backend config, and agent card.
  This replaces the previous Persona, SystemPrompt, and AgentCard resources.
  """
  
  use Ash.Resource,
    domain: AshChat.Domain,
    data_layer: Ash.DataLayer.Ets

  resource do
    description "AI Agent with complete configuration"
  end

  attributes do
    uuid_primary_key :id
    
    # Identity
    attribute :name, :string, public?: true
    attribute :description, :string, public?: true
    attribute :avatar_url, :string, public?: true
    
    # Backend Configuration
    attribute :provider, :atom do
      public? true
      constraints one_of: [:ollama, :openrouter, :claude_oneshot, :claude_session]
    end
    attribute :endpoint, :string, public?: true
    attribute :api_key, :string, public?: true, sensitive?: true
    attribute :model, :string, public?: true
    
    # Personality
    attribute :system_prompt, :string, public?: true
    
    # Inference Settings
    attribute :temperature, :float, public?: true, default: 0.7
    attribute :max_tokens, :integer, public?: true, default: 500
    attribute :top_p, :float, public?: true, default: 0.9
    attribute :top_k, :integer, public?: true
    
    # Context Strategy
    attribute :context_format, :atom do
      public? true
      default :consolidated
      constraints one_of: [:consolidated, :message_per_message, :claude_style]
    end
    attribute :context_window, :integer, public?: true, default: 20
    
    # Features
    attribute :available_tools, {:array, :string}, public?: true, default: []
    attribute :add_to_new_rooms, :boolean, public?: true, default: false
    attribute :is_default, :boolean, public?: true, default: false
    attribute :is_active, :boolean, public?: true, default: true
    
    # Versioning
    attribute :version, :integer, public?: true, default: 1
    attribute :parent_agent_id, :uuid, public?: true
    attribute :version_notes, :string, public?: true
    
    create_timestamp :created_at
    update_timestamp :updated_at
  end

  validations do
    validate present(:name), message: "Agent name is required"
    validate present(:provider), message: "Provider is required"
    validate present(:model), message: "Model is required"
    validate present(:system_prompt), message: "System prompt is required"
    
    # Provider-specific validations
    validate present(:endpoint), 
      where: [attribute_in(:provider, [:ollama, :openrouter])],
      message: "Endpoint URL is required for this provider"
      
    validate present(:api_key),
      where: [attribute_equals(:provider, :openrouter)],
      message: "API key is required for OpenRouter"
  end

  actions do
    defaults [:read, :destroy]

    create :create do
      accept [
        :name, :description, :avatar_url,
        :provider, :endpoint, :api_key, :model,
        :system_prompt,
        :temperature, :max_tokens, :top_p, :top_k,
        :context_format, :context_window,
        :available_tools, :add_to_new_rooms, :is_default, :is_active,
        :version, :parent_agent_id, :version_notes
      ]
      
      change fn changeset, _context ->
        # If setting as default, unset other defaults
        if Ash.Changeset.get_attribute(changeset, :is_default) do
          # TODO: Implement unsetting other defaults
          changeset
        else
          changeset
        end
      end
    end
    
    update :update do
      accept [
        :name, :description, :avatar_url,
        :endpoint, :api_key, :model,
        :system_prompt,
        :temperature, :max_tokens, :top_p, :top_k,
        :context_format, :context_window,
        :available_tools, :add_to_new_rooms, :is_default, :is_active
      ]
    end
    
    update :duplicate do
      manual fn changeset, _context ->
        original = changeset.data
        
        new_attrs = %{
          name: "#{original.name} (Copy)",
          description: original.description,
          avatar_url: original.avatar_url,
          provider: original.provider,
          endpoint: original.endpoint,
          api_key: original.api_key,
          model: original.model,
          system_prompt: original.system_prompt,
          temperature: original.temperature,
          max_tokens: original.max_tokens,
          top_p: original.top_p,
          top_k: original.top_k,
          context_format: original.context_format,
          context_window: original.context_window,
          available_tools: original.available_tools,
          add_to_new_rooms: false,
          is_default: false,
          is_active: true,
          version: 1,
          parent_agent_id: original.id,
          version_notes: "Duplicated from #{original.name}"
        }
        
        case __MODULE__.create(new_attrs) do
          {:ok, new_agent} -> {:ok, new_agent}
          {:error, error} -> {:error, error}
        end
      end
    end
    
    read :get do
      get? true
    end
    
    read :active do
      filter expr(is_active == true)
    end
    
    read :default do
      filter expr(is_default == true)
    end
  end

  code_interface do
    domain AshChat.Domain
    define :create
    define :read
    define :get
    define :update
    define :destroy
    define :duplicate
    define :get_active, action: :active
    define :get_default, action: :default
  end
end

defmodule AshChat.Providers.Ollama do
  @moduledoc """
  Ollama provider implementation for local model inference.
  """
  
  @behaviour AshChat.Provider
  
  require Logger
  
  @impl true
  def send_message(agent, context, opts \\ []) do
    url = "#{agent.endpoint}/api/chat"
    
    body = %{
      model: agent.model,
      messages: context,
      temperature: agent.temperature,
      max_tokens: agent.max_tokens,
      top_p: agent.top_p,
      stream: opts[:stream] || false
    }
    |> remove_nil_values()
    
    headers = [{"Content-Type", "application/json"}]
    
    case HTTPoison.post(url, Jason.encode!(body), headers, recv_timeout: 60_000) do
      {:ok, %{status_code: 200, body: response_body}} ->
        handle_response(response_body, opts[:stream] || false)
        
      {:ok, %{status_code: status_code, body: error_body}} ->
        {:error, "Ollama error (#{status_code}): #{error_body}"}
        
      {:error, %HTTPoison.Error{reason: reason}} ->
        {:error, "Network error: #{inspect(reason)}"}
    end
  end
  
  @impl true
  def format_context(agent, messages) do
    case agent.context_format do
      :consolidated ->
        format_consolidated(agent, messages)
      :message_per_message ->
        format_message_per_message(agent, messages)
      _ ->
        format_message_per_message(agent, messages)
    end
  end
  
  @impl true
  def health_check(agent) do
    url = "#{agent.endpoint}/api/tags"
    
    case HTTPoison.get(url, [], recv_timeout: 5_000) do
      {:ok, %{status_code: 200, body: body}} ->
        case Jason.decode(body) do
          {:ok, data} ->
            models = Enum.map(data["models"] || [], & &1["name"])
            {:ok, %{available: true, models: models}}
          _ ->
            {:ok, %{available: true, models: []}}
        end
        
      _ ->
        {:error, "Cannot connect to Ollama at #{agent.endpoint}"}
    end
  end
  
  # Private functions
  
  defp handle_response(body, false) do
    case Jason.decode(body) do
      {:ok, %{"message" => %{"content" => content}}} ->
        {:ok, content}
      {:ok, data} ->
        {:error, "Unexpected response format: #{inspect(data)}"}
      {:error, error} ->
        {:error, "JSON decode error: #{inspect(error)}"}
    end
  end
  
  defp handle_response(body, true) do
    # For streaming, we'd need to handle Server-Sent Events
    # For now, just parse the first complete response
    {:ok, body}
  end
  
  defp format_consolidated(agent, messages) do
    recent_messages = Enum.take(messages, -agent.context_window)
    
    history = recent_messages
    |> Enum.map(fn msg -> 
      role = if msg.user_id, do: "User", else: "Assistant"
      "#{role}: #{msg.content}"
    end)
    |> Enum.join("\n")
    
    [
      %{"role" => "system", "content" => agent.system_prompt},
      %{"role" => "user", "content" => history}
    ]
  end
  
  defp format_message_per_message(agent, messages) do
    recent_messages = Enum.take(messages, -agent.context_window)
    
    system_message = %{"role" => "system", "content" => agent.system_prompt}
    
    formatted_messages = Enum.map(recent_messages, fn msg ->
      role = if msg.user_id, do: "user", else: "assistant"
      %{"role" => role, "content" => msg.content}
    end)
    
    [system_message | formatted_messages]
  end
  
  defp remove_nil_values(map) do
    map
    |> Enum.filter(fn {_, v} -> v != nil end)
    |> Enum.into(%{})
  end
end

    |> Enum.filter(fn {_, v} -> v != nil end)
    |> Enum.into(%{})
  end
end

content.thinking:
Good point! The user is concerned about:
1. Naming conflict with Ash AI's "agent" concept
2. Whether this model supports different types of personalities (employees, visitors, guests, experts, friends)

Let me think about better naming:
- Character (but we already have a Character resource)
- Personality 
- Companion
- Entity
- Being
- Participant
- ChatPartner
- Conversationalist
- Identity

I think "Participant" or "Companion" might be good alternatives. Let me also add a "participant_type" or "companion_type" field to distinguish between different kinds of entities (AI assistants, simulated people, experts, etc).

content.text:
Excellent point! "Agent" could indeed conflict with Ash's internal concepts. Let me rename it to something more descriptive that also supports your use case of different personality types.

How about `Companion`? This better captures the idea of various chat partners - whether they're AI assistants, simulated people, experts, or friends.

toolUseResult.originalFile:
defmodule AshChat.Resources.Agent do
  @moduledoc """
  Unified Agent entity that combines persona, backend config, and agent card.
  This replaces the previous Persona, SystemPrompt, and AgentCard resources.
  """
  
  use Ash.Resource,
    domain: AshChat.Domain,
    data_layer: Ash.DataLayer.Ets

  resource do
    description "AI Agent with complete configuration"
  end

  attributes do
    uuid_primary_key :id
    
    # Identity
    attribute :name, :string, public?: true
    attribute :description, :string, public?: true
    attribute :avatar_url, :string, public?: true
    
    # Backend Configuration
    attribute :provider, :atom do
      public? true
      constraints one_of: [:ollama, :openrouter, :claude_oneshot, :claude_session]
    end
    attribute :endpoint, :string, public?: true
    attribute :api_key, :string, public?: true, sensitive?: true
    attribute :model, :string, public?: true
    
    # Personality
    attribute :system_prompt, :string, public?: true
    
    # Inference Settings
    attribute :temperature, :float, public?: true, default: 0.7
    attribute :max_tokens, :integer, public?: true, default: 500
    attribute :top_p, :float, public?: true, default: 0.9
    attribute :top_k, :integer, public?: true
    
    # Context Strategy
    attribute :context_format, :atom do
      public? true
      default :consolidated
      constraints one_of: [:consolidated, :message_per_message, :claude_style]
    end
    attribute :context_window, :integer, public?: true, default: 20
    
    # Features
    attribute :available_tools, {:array, :string}, public?: true, default: []
    attribute :add_to_new_rooms, :boolean, public?: true, default: false
    attribute :is_default, :boolean, public?: true, default: false
    attribute :is_active, :boolean, public?: true, default: true
    
    # Versioning
    attribute :version, :integer, public?: true, default: 1
    attribute :parent_agent_id, :uuid, public?: true
    attribute :version_notes, :string, public?: true
    
    create_timestamp :created_at
    update_timestamp :updated_at
  end

  validations do
    validate present(:name), message: "Agent name is required"
    validate present(:provider), message: "Provider is required"
    validate present(:model), message: "Model is required"
    validate present(:system_prompt), message: "System prompt is required"
    
    # Provider-specific validations
    validate present(:endpoint), 
      where: [attribute_in(:provider, [:ollama, :openrouter])],
      message: "Endpoint URL is required for this provider"
      
    validate present(:api_key),
      where: [attribute_equals(:provider, :openrouter)],
      message: "API key is required for OpenRouter"
  end

  actions do
    defaults [:read, :destroy]

    create :create do
      accept [
        :name, :description, :avatar_url,
        :provider, :endpoint, :api_key, :model,
        :system_prompt,
        :temperature, :max_tokens, :top_p, :top_k,
        :context_format, :context_window,
        :available_tools, :add_to_new_rooms, :is_default, :is_active,
        :version, :parent_agent_id, :version_notes
      ]
      
      change fn changeset, _context ->
        # If setting as default, unset other defaults
        if Ash.Changeset.get_attribute(changeset, :is_default) do
          # TODO: Implement unsetting other defaults
          changeset
        else
          changeset
        end
      end
    end
    
    update :update do
      accept [
        :name, :description, :avatar_url,
        :endpoint, :api_key, :model,
        :system_prompt,
        :temperature, :max_tokens, :top_p, :top_k,
        :context_format, :context_window,
        :available_tools, :add_to_new_rooms, :is_default, :is_active
      ]
    end
    
    update :duplicate do
      manual fn changeset, _context ->
        original = changeset.data
        
        new_attrs = %{
          name: "#{original.name} (Copy)",
          description: original.description,
          avatar_url: original.avatar_url,
          provider: original.provider,
          endpoint: original.endpoint,
          api_key: original.api_key,
          model: original.model,
          system_prompt: original.system_prompt,
          temperature: original.temperature,
          max_tokens: original.max_tokens,
          top_p: original.top_p,
          top_k: original.top_k,
          context_format: original.context_format,
          context_window: original.context_window,
          available_tools: original.available_tools,
          add_to_new_rooms: false,
          is_default: false,
          is_active: true,
          version: 1,
          parent_agent_id: original.id,
          version_notes: "Duplicated from #{original.name}"
        }
        
        case __MODULE__.create(new_attrs) do
          {:ok, new_agent} -> {:ok, new_agent}
          {:error, error} -> {:error, error}
        end
      end
    end
    
    read :get do
      get? true
    end
    
    read :active do
      filter expr(is_active == true)
    end
    
    read :default do
      filter expr(is_default == true)
    end
  end

  code_interface do
    domain AshChat.Domain
    define :create
    define :read
    define :get
    define :update
    define :destroy
    define :duplicate
    define :get_active, action: :active
    define :get_default, action: :default
  end
end

toolUseResult.originalFile:
defmodule AshChat.Providers.Ollama do
  @moduledoc """
  Ollama provider implementation for local model inference.
  """
  
  @behaviour AshChat.Provider
  
  require Logger
  
  @impl true
  def send_message(agent, context, opts \\ []) do
    url = "#{agent.endpoint}/api/chat"
    
    body = %{
      model: agent.model,
      messages: context,
      temperature: agent.temperature,
      max_tokens: agent.max_tokens,
      top_p: agent.top_p,
      stream: opts[:stream] || false
    }
    |> remove_nil_values()
    
    headers = [{"Content-Type", "application/json"}]
    
    case HTTPoison.post(url, Jason.encode!(body), headers, recv_timeout: 60_000) do
      {:ok, %{status_code: 200, body: response_body}} ->
        handle_response(response_body, opts[:stream] || false)
        
      {:ok, %{status_code: status_code, body: error_body}} ->
        {:error, "Ollama error (#{status_code}): #{error_body}"}
        
      {:error, %HTTPoison.Error{reason: reason}} ->
        {:error, "Network error: #{inspect(reason)}"}
    end
  end
  
  @impl true
  def format_context(agent, messages) do
    case agent.context_format do
      :consolidated ->
        format_consolidated(agent, messages)
      :message_per_message ->
        format_message_per_message(agent, messages)
      _ ->
        format_message_per_message(agent, messages)
    end
  end
  
  @impl true
  def health_check(agent) do
    url = "#{agent.endpoint}/api/tags"
    
    case HTTPoison.get(url, [], recv_timeout: 5_000) do
      {:ok, %{status_code: 200, body: body}} ->
        case Jason.decode(body) do
          {:ok, data} ->
            models = Enum.map(data["models"] || [], & &1["name"])
            {:ok, %{available: true, models: models}}
          _ ->
            {:ok, %{available: true, models: []}}
        end
        
      _ ->
        {:error, "Cannot connect to Ollama at #{agent.endpoint}"}
    end
  end
  
  # Private functions
  
  defp handle_response(body, false) do
    case Jason.decode(body) do
      {:ok, %{"message" => %{"content" => content}}} ->
        {:ok, content}
      {:ok, data} ->
        {:error, "Unexpected response format: #{inspect(data)}"}
      {:error, error} ->
        {:error, "JSON decode error: #{inspect(error)}"}
    end
  end
  
  defp handle_response(body, true) do
    # For streaming, we'd need to handle Server-Sent Events
    # For now, just parse the first complete response
    {:ok, body}
  end
  
  defp format_consolidated(agent, messages) do
    recent_messages = Enum.take(messages, -agent.context_window)
    
    history = recent_messages
    |> Enum.map(fn msg -> 
      role = if msg.user_id, do: "User", else: "Assistant"
      "#{role}: #{msg.content}"
    end)
    |> Enum.join("\n")
    
    [
      %{"role" => "system", "content" => agent.system_prompt},
      %{"role" => "user", "content" => history}
    ]
  end
  
  defp format_message_per_message(agent, messages) do
    recent_messages = Enum.take(messages, -agent.context_window)
    
    system_message = %{"role" => "system", "content" => agent.system_prompt}
    
    formatted_messages = Enum.map(recent_messages, fn msg ->
      role = if msg.user_id, do: "user", else: "assistant"
      %{"role" => role, "content" => msg.content}
    end)
    
    [system_message | formatted_messages]
  end
  
  defp remove_nil_values(map) do
    map
    |> Enum.filter(fn {_, v} -> v != nil end)
    |> Enum.into(%{})
  end
end

defmodule AshChat.Providers.Ollama do
  @moduledoc """
  Ollama provider implementation for local model inference.
  """
  
  @behaviour AshChat.Provider
  
  require Logger
  
  @impl true
  def send_message(companion, context, opts \\ []) do
    url = "#{companion.endpoint}/api/chat"
    
    body = %{
      model: companion.model,
      messages: context,
      temperature: companion.temperature,
      max_tokens: companion.max_tokens,
      top_p: companion.top_p,
      stream: opts[:stream] || false
    }
    |> remove_nil_values()
    
    headers = [{"Content-Type", "application/json"}]
    
    case HTTPoison.post(url, Jason.encode!(body), headers, recv_timeout: 60_000) do
      {:ok, %{status_code: 200, body: response_body}} ->
        handle_response(response_body, opts[:stream] || false)
        
      {:ok, %{status_code: status_code, body: error_body}} ->
        {:error, "Ollama error (#{status_code}): #{error_body}"}
        
      {:error, %HTTPoison.Error{reason: reason}} ->
        {:error, "Network error: #{inspect(reason)}"}
    end
  end
  
  @impl true
  def format_context(companion, messages) do
    case companion.context_format do
      :consolidated ->
        format_consolidated(companion, messages)
      :message_per_message ->
        format_message_per_message(companion, messages)
      _ ->
        format_message_per_message(companion, messages)
    end
  end
  
  @impl true
  def health_check(companion) do
    url = "#{companion.endpoint}/api/tags"
    
    case HTTPoison.get(url, [], recv_timeout: 5_000) do
      {:ok, %{status_code: 200, body: body}} ->
        case Jason.decode(body) do
          {:ok, data} ->
            models = Enum.map(data["models"] || [], & &1["name"])
            {:ok, %{available: true, models: models}}
          _ ->
            {:ok, %{available: true, models: []}}
        end
        
      _ ->
        {:error, "Cannot connect to Ollama at #{agent.endpoint}"}
    end
  end
  
  # Private functions
  
  defp handle_response(body, false) do
    case Jason.decode(body) do
      {:ok, %{"message" => %{"content" => content}}} ->
        {:ok, content}
      {:ok, data} ->
        {:error, "Unexpected response format: #{inspect(data)}"}
      {:error, error} ->
        {:error, "JSON decode error: #{inspect(error)}"}
    end
  end
  
  defp handle_response(body, true) do
    # For streaming, we'd need to handle Server-Sent Events
    # For now, just parse the first complete response
    {:ok, body}
  end
  
  defp format_consolidated(agent, messages) do
    recent_messages = Enum.take(messages, -agent.context_window)
    
    history = recent_messages
    |> Enum.map(fn msg -> 
      role = if msg.user_id, do: "User", else: "Assistant"
      "#{role}: #{msg.content}"
    end)
    |> Enum.join("\n")
    
    [
      %{"role" => "system", "content" => agent.system_prompt},
      %{"role" => "user", "content" => history}
    ]
  end
  
  defp format_message_per_message(agent, messages) do
    recent_messages = Enum.take(messages, -agent.context_window)
    
    system_message = %{"role" => "system", "content" => agent.system_prompt}

Now let me step back and do a high-level review of this refactoring work.

## 50,000 Foot View

Looking at what we're building:
1. A chat system with various types of participants (AI assistants, simulated people, experts, friends)
2. Multiple backend providers (Ollama, OpenRouter, Claude)
3. Flexible context management strategies
4. Version control for configurations

## 10,000 Foot View

Our current approach:
1. Unified "Companion" entity combining identity + backend config + personality
2. Provider strategy pattern for different AI backends
3. Context formatting strategies (consolidated vs message-per-message)
4. Companion types to distinguish different kinds of participants

## Critical Review

### Strengths:
1. Single entity is simpler than the 3-entity hop
2. Companion naming avoids Ash conflicts and better represents diverse participants
3. Provider pattern allows backend-specific behavior
4. companion_type field enables the user's vision of diverse personalities

### Weaknesses:
1. **Tight coupling**: Backend config (URL, API key) is bundled with personality (system prompt, name)
2. **Duplication**: If I want the same personality on different backends, I need duplicate companions
3. **Context strategy**: Might be better at the message/room level than companion level
4. **Missing abstraction**: No clear separation between "who they are" vs "how they work"

### Better Architecture?

Maybe we need TWO entities:
1. **Identity**: Who they are (name, personality, type, avatar)
2. **Backend**: How they work (provider, endpoint, model, context strategy)

Then a companion selects an identity + backend combination.

But wait... that's getting complex again. Let me think about real use cases:
- User wants "Maya" to work on both Ollama and Claude
- User wants to test different context strategies with same personality
- User wants to duplicate and tweak personalities
 
Our current single-entity approach handles these through duplication, which is... actually fine? It's explicit and clear.

I see the current implementation provides a straightforward solution. The single-entity model allows direct configuration and easy replication of companions across different backends. By embracing explicit duplication, we maintain clarity and simplicity in the system design. 

The proposed improvements focus on enhancing flexibility and metadata management. Adding a personality template field enables easier personality sharing and modification. Moving context formatting to the room or message level provides more granular control. Tags and capabilities fields will support better companion organization and feature management.

These refinements maintain the core strength of the current approach while introducing more nuanced configuration options. The goal is to create a system that's both powerful and intuitive, allowing users to easily define, replicate, and customize their AI companions.

content.text:
Now let me step back and do a comprehensive review of this architecture.

## 50,000 Foot View - The Big Picture

We're building a system where humans can interact with various AI personalities - from professional assistants to simulated friends, experts, or even fictional characters. The key insight is that these are all "companions" in conversation, not just "agents" or "bots".

## 10,000 Foot Review - Architecture Assessment

### Current Design
- **Single Companion entity** combining identity + backend + personality
- **Provider pattern** for backend-specific behavior  
- **Companion types** for different participant categories
- **Context strategies** built into each companion

### Critical Analysis

**Strengths:**
1. ✅ Simplicity - one entity to understand
2. ✅ Clear versioning/duplication  
3. ✅ Avoids over-engineering
4. ✅ "Companion" naming captures the human-like aspect

**Weaknesses:**
1. ❌ Tight coupling of concerns (identity vs infrastructure)
2. ❌ Context strategy might be better per-conversation
3. ❌ No way to share personalities across backends
4. ❌ Missing social/capability metadata

## Proposed Improvements

Let me add some fields to make this more flexible:

toolUseResult.originalFile:
defmodule AshChat.Resources.Companion do
  @moduledoc """
  Unified Companion entity for all chat participants - AI assistants, simulated people,
  experts, friends, etc. Combines identity, backend config, and personality.
  This replaces the previous Persona, SystemPrompt, and AgentCard resources.
  """
  
  use Ash.Resource,
    domain: AshChat.Domain,
    data_layer: Ash.DataLayer.Ets

  resource do
    description "Chat companion with complete configuration"
  end

  attributes do
    uuid_primary_key :id
    
    # Identity
    attribute :name, :string, public?: true
    attribute :description, :string, public?: true
    attribute :avatar_url, :string, public?: true
    
    # Companion Type
    attribute :companion_type, :atom do
      public? true
      constraints one_of: [:assistant, :employee, :visitor, :guest, :expert, :friend, :character]
      default :assistant
    end
    
    # Backend Configuration
    attribute :provider, :atom do
      public? true
      constraints one_of: [:ollama, :openrouter, :claude_oneshot, :claude_session]
    end
    attribute :endpoint, :string, public?: true
    attribute :api_key, :string, public?: true, sensitive?: true
    attribute :model, :string, public?: true
    
    # Personality
    attribute :system_prompt, :string, public?: true
    
    # Inference Settings
    attribute :temperature, :float, public?: true, default: 0.7
    attribute :max_tokens, :integer, public?: true, default: 500
    attribute :top_p, :float, public?: true, default: 0.9
    attribute :top_k, :integer, public?: true
    
    # Context Strategy
    attribute :context_format, :atom do
      public? true
      default :consolidated
      constraints one_of: [:consolidated, :message_per_message, :claude_style]
    end
    attribute :context_window, :integer, public?: true, default: 20
    
    # Features
    attribute :available_tools, {:array, :string}, public?: true, default: []
    attribute :add_to_new_rooms, :boolean, public?: true, default: false
    attribute :is_default, :boolean, public?: true, default: false
    attribute :is_active, :boolean, public?: true, default: true
    
    # Versioning
    attribute :version, :integer, public?: true, default: 1
    attribute :parent_companion_id, :uuid, public?: true
    attribute :version_notes, :string, public?: true
    
    create_timestamp :created_at
    update_timestamp :updated_at
  end

  validations do
    validate present(:name), message: "Companion name is required"
    validate present(:provider), message: "Provider is required"
    validate present(:model), message: "Model is required"
    validate present(:system_prompt), message: "System prompt is required"
    
    # Provider-specific validations
    validate present(:endpoint), 
      where: [attribute_in(:provider, [:ollama, :openrouter])],
      message: "Endpoint URL is required for this provider"
      
    validate present(:api_key),
      where: [attribute_equals(:provider, :openrouter)],
      message: "API key is required for OpenRouter"
  end

  actions do
    defaults [:read, :destroy]

    create :create do
      accept [
        :name, :description, :avatar_url,
        :provider, :endpoint, :api_key, :model,
        :system_prompt,
        :temperature, :max_tokens, :top_p, :top_k,
        :context_format, :context_window,
        :available_tools, :add_to_new_rooms, :is_default, :is_active,
        :version, :parent_companion_id, :version_notes, :companion_type
      ]
      
      change fn changeset, _context ->
        # If setting as default, unset other defaults
        if Ash.Changeset.get_attribute(changeset, :is_default) do
          # TODO: Implement unsetting other defaults
          changeset
        else
          changeset
        end
      end
    end
    
    update :update do
      accept [
        :name, :description, :avatar_url,
        :endpoint, :api_key, :model,
        :system_prompt,
        :temperature, :max_tokens, :top_p, :top_k,
        :context_format, :context_window,
        :available_tools, :add_to_new_rooms, :is_default, :is_active
      ]
    end
    
    update :duplicate do
      manual fn changeset, _context ->
        original = changeset.data
        
        new_attrs = %{
          name: "#{original.name} (Copy)",
          description: original.description,
          avatar_url: original.avatar_url,
          provider: original.provider,
          endpoint: original.endpoint,
          api_key: original.api_key,
          model: original.model,
          system_prompt: original.system_prompt,
          temperature: original.temperature,
          max_tokens: original.max_tokens,
          top_p: original.top_p,
          top_k: original.top_k,
          context_format: original.context_format,
          context_window: original.context_window,
          available_tools: original.available_tools,
          add_to_new_rooms: false,
          is_default: false,
          is_active: true,
          version: 1,
          parent_companion_id: original.id,
          companion_type: original.companion_type,
          version_notes: "Duplicated from #{original.name}"
        }
        
        case __MODULE__.create(new_attrs) do
          {:ok, new_companion} -> {:ok, new_companion}
          {:error, error} -> {:error, error}
        end
      end
    end
    
    read :get do
      get? true
    end
    
    read :active do
      filter expr(is_active == true)
    end
    
    read :default do
      filter expr(is_default == true)
    end
  end

  code_interface do
    domain AshChat.Domain
    define :create
    define :read
    define :get
    define :update
    define :destroy
    define :duplicate
    define :get_active, action: :active
    define :get_default, action: :default
  end
end

    create :create do

    define :update
    define :destroy
    define :duplicate
    define :get_active, action: :active

  end

toolUseResult.originalFile:
defmodule AshChat.Resources.Companion do
  @moduledoc """
  Unified Companion entity for all chat participants - AI assistants, simulated people,
  experts, friends, etc. Combines identity, backend config, and personality.
  This replaces the previous Persona, SystemPrompt, and AgentCard resources.
  """
  
  use Ash.Resource,
    domain: AshChat.Domain,
    data_layer: Ash.DataLayer.Ets

  resource do
    description "Chat companion with complete configuration"
  end

  attributes do
    uuid_primary_key :id
    
    # Identity
    attribute :name, :string, public?: true
    attribute :description, :string, public?: true
    attribute :avatar_url, :string, public?: true
    
    # Companion Type
    attribute :companion_type, :atom do
      public? true
      constraints one_of: [:assistant, :employee, :visitor, :guest, :expert, :friend, :character]
      default :assistant
    end
    
    # Backend Configuration
    attribute :provider, :atom do
      public? true
      constraints one_of: [:ollama, :openrouter, :claude_oneshot, :claude_session]
    end
    attribute :endpoint, :string, public?: true
    attribute :api_key, :string, public?: true, sensitive?: true
    attribute :model, :string, public?: true
    
    # Personality
    attribute :system_prompt, :string, public?: true
    
    # Inference Settings
    attribute :temperature, :float, public?: true, default: 0.7
    attribute :max_tokens, :integer, public?: true, default: 500
    attribute :top_p, :float, public?: true, default: 0.9
    attribute :top_k, :integer, public?: true
    
    # Context Strategy
    attribute :context_format, :atom do
      public? true
      default :consolidated
      constraints one_of: [:consolidated, :message_per_message, :claude_style]
    end
    attribute :context_window, :integer, public?: true, default: 20
    
    # Features & Capabilities
    attribute :available_tools, {:array, :string}, public?: true, default: []
    attribute :capabilities, {:array, :atom}, public?: true, default: []
    # e.g. [:memory, :web_search, :code_execution, :image_generation]
    
    # Social Metadata
    attribute :tags, {:array, :string}, public?: true, default: []
    # e.g. ["technical", "friendly", "professional", "creative"]
    attribute :personality_notes, :string, public?: true
    # Free-form notes about personality traits, backstory, etc.
    
    # Behavior Settings
    attribute :add_to_new_rooms, :boolean, public?: true, default: false
    attribute :is_default, :boolean, public?: true, default: false
    attribute :is_active, :boolean, public?: true, default: true
    attribute :auto_respond, :boolean, public?: true, default: true
    attribute :response_style, :map, public?: true, default: %{}
    # e.g. %{formality: "casual", verbosity: "concise", emoji_use: true}
    
    # Versioning
    attribute :version, :integer, public?: true, default: 1
    attribute :parent_companion_id, :uuid, public?: true
    attribute :version_notes, :string, public?: true
    
    create_timestamp :created_at
    update_timestamp :updated_at
  end

  validations do
    validate present(:name), message: "Companion name is required"
    validate present(:provider), message: "Provider is required"
    validate present(:model), message: "Model is required"
    validate present(:system_prompt), message: "System prompt is required"
    
    # Provider-specific validations
    validate present(:endpoint), 
      where: [attribute_in(:provider, [:ollama, :openrouter])],
      message: "Endpoint URL is required for this provider"
      
    validate present(:api_key),
      where: [attribute_equals(:provider, :openrouter)],
      message: "API key is required for OpenRouter"
  end

  actions do
    defaults [:read, :destroy]

    create :create do
      accept [
        :name, :description, :avatar_url,
        :provider, :endpoint, :api_key, :model,
        :system_prompt,
        :temperature, :max_tokens, :top_p, :top_k,
        :context_format, :context_window,
        :available_tools, :capabilities, :tags, :personality_notes,
        :add_to_new_rooms, :is_default, :is_active, :auto_respond,
        :response_style,
        :version, :parent_companion_id, :version_notes, :companion_type
      ]
      
      change fn changeset, _context ->
        # If setting as default, unset other defaults
        if Ash.Changeset.get_attribute(changeset, :is_default) do
          # TODO: Implement unsetting other defaults
          changeset
        else
          changeset
        end
      end
    end
    
    update :update do
      accept [
        :name, :description, :avatar_url,
        :endpoint, :api_key, :model,
        :system_prompt,
        :temperature, :max_tokens, :top_p, :top_k,
        :context_format, :context_window,
        :available_tools, :capabilities, :tags, :personality_notes,
        :add_to_new_rooms, :is_default, :is_active, :auto_respond,
        :response_style
      ]
    end
    
    update :duplicate do
      manual fn changeset, _context ->
        original = changeset.data
        
        new_attrs = %{
          name: "#{original.name} (Copy)",
          description: original.description,
          avatar_url: original.avatar_url,
          provider: original.provider,
          endpoint: original.endpoint,
          api_key: original.api_key,
          model: original.model,
          system_prompt: original.system_prompt,
          temperature: original.temperature,
          max_tokens: original.max_tokens,
          top_p: original.top_p,
          top_k: original.top_k,
          context_format: original.context_format,
          context_window: original.context_window,
          available_tools: original.available_tools,
          add_to_new_rooms: false,
          is_default: false,
          is_active: true,
          version: 1,
          parent_companion_id: original.id,
          companion_type: original.companion_type,
          version_notes: "Duplicated from #{original.name}"
        }
        
        case __MODULE__.create(new_attrs) do
          {:ok, new_companion} -> {:ok, new_companion}
          {:error, error} -> {:error, error}
        end
      end
    end
    
    read :get do
      get? true
    end
    
    read :active do
      filter expr(is_active == true)
    end
    
    read :default do
      filter expr(is_default == true)
    end
  end

  code_interface do
    domain AshChat.Domain
    define :create
    define :read
    define :get
    define :update
    define :destroy
    define :duplicate
    define :get_active, action: :active
    define :get_default, action: :default
  end
end
